CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Initial Contact stage positioned above or below the Proposal Sent stage?
SRP.A: The Initial Contact stage is positioned {above} the Proposal Sent stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Lead Captured?
VE.A: The value of stage Lead Captured is {1060}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Negotiation?
VE.A: The value of stage Negotiation is {210}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Needs Analysis?
VE.A: The value of stage Needs Analysis is {461}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Lead Captured, with a value of {1060}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Client Onboarded, with a value of {179}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Negotiation to stage Contract Signed?
SC.A: Decreased by {0} Clients from stage Negotiation to stage Contract Signed.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 871? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 257? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Negotiation} stage has {210}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {210}, the {Client Onboarded} stage has {179}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 210 and 571? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Needs Analysis} stage has {461}, the {Proposal Sent} stage has {304}, the {Negotiation} stage has {210}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {210}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Contract Signed to Client Onboarded, or from stage Initial Contact to Needs Analysis?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Initial Contact} to {Needs Analysis} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Negotiation to Contract Signed, from stage Proposal Sent to Negotiation, or from stage Contract Signed to Client Onboarded?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Proposal Sent} to stage {Negotiation} is the greatest.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Initial Contact to Needs Analysis, from stage Lead Captured to Initial Contact, or from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Lead Captured} to stage {Initial Contact} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Lead Captured} and {Initial Contact} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Negotiation} and {Contract Signed} stages.
